translated: Of those eighty-four thousand elephants, there was only one that I rode at that time, namely, the royal bull elephant named Uposatha.🔽Of those eighty-four thousand horses, there was only one that I rode at that time, namely, the royal steed named Valāhaka.

original: Tesaṁ kho panānanda, caturāsīti rathasahassānaṁ ekoyeva so ratho hoti, yaṁ tena samayena abhiruhāmi yadidaṁ vejayantaratho.
analyzed: tesam kho pana ānanda catur āsīti ratha sahassānam eko yā iva saḥ rathaḥ hoti yam tena samayena abhiruhāmi yat idam vejayanta rathaḥ
translated: Of those eighty-four thousand chariots, there was only one that I rode at that time, namely, the chariot named Vejayanta.

original: Tesaṁ kho panānanda, caturāsīti itthisahassānaṁ ekāyeva sā itthī hoti, yā tena samayena paccupaṭṭhāti khattiyānī vā vessinī vā.
analyzed: tesam kho pana ānanda caturāsīti itthi sahassānaṃ ekāyā iva sā itthī hoti yā tena samayena paccupaṭṭhāti khattiyānī vā vessinī vā
translated: Of those eighty-four thousand women, there was only one that served me at that time, namely, the noble lady or the brahmin lady.

original: Tesaṁ kho panānanda, caturāsīti vatthakoṭisahassānaṁ ekaṁyeva taṁ dussayugaṁ hoti,
analyzed: tesam kho pana ānanda caturāsīti vattha koṭi sahassānam ekayā iva tat dussayugam hoti
translated: And of those 84,000 suits of clothing, there was only one pair that he used.

original: yaṁ tena samayena paridahāmi khomasukhumaṁ vā kappāsikasukhumaṁ vā koseyyasukhumaṁ
analyzed: yam tena samayena paridahāmi khoma sukhumam vā kappāsika sukhumam vā koseyya sukhuma
translated: And of those 84,000 suits of clothing, I would wear only one,

original: vā kambalasukhumaṁ vā.
analyzed: vā kambala su khumam vā
translated: made of linen, cotton, silk, or wool.🔽And of those 84,000 serving-men, I would serve only one,

original: Tesaṁ kho panānanda, caturāsīti thālipākasahassānaṁ ekoyeva so thālipāko hoti, yato nāḷikodanaparamaṁ bhuñjāmi tadupiyañca sūpeyyaṁ.
analyzed: tesam kho pana ānanda catur āsīti thālipāka sahassānam eko yā iva saḥ thālipākaḥ hoti yatas nāḷika udana paramam bhuñjāmi tat upiyam ca su upeyya
translated: who would bring me my food, whatever I wanted, and my soup.

original: Passānanda, sabbete saṅkhārā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā.
analyzed: passa ānanda sabba ete saṅkhārāḥ atītāḥ niruddhāḥ vipariṇatā
translated: See, Ānanda, all these formations have passed, ceased, changed.

original: Evaṁ aniccā kho, ānanda, saṅkhārā;🔽evaṁ addhuvā kho, ānanda, saṅkhārā;
analyzed: evam aniccā kho ānanda saṅkhārā  evam addhuvā khalu ānanda saṅkhārā
translated: So impermanent are formations, Ānanda,🔽so unstable, so unreliable.

original: evaṁ anassāsikā kho, ānanda, saṅkhārā.🔽Yāvañcidaṁ, ānanda, alameva sabbasaṅkhāresu nibbindituṁ, alaṁ virajjituṁ, alaṁ vimuccituṁ.
analyzed: evam anassāsikāḥ kho ānanda saṅkhārāḥ  yāvañcida ānanda alam eva sabba saṅkhāresu nibbinditu alam virajjitu alam vimuccitu
translated: Enough of formations, Ānanda!

original: Chakkhattuṁ kho panāhaṁ, ānanda, abhijānāmi imasmiṁ padese sarīraṁ nikkhipitaṁ, tañca
analyzed: chakkhattum kho pana aha ānanda abhijānāmi imasmin padese sarīram nikkhipita tat ca
translated: Six times, Ānanda, I have seen this body laid out,

original: kho rājāva samāno cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto
analyzed: kho rājā ava samānaḥ cakkavattī dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā cāturantaḥ vijitāvī janapadatthāvariya ppatto
translated: and as a universal monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, he conquers the earth by wheel, and then rules by maintaining it.

original: sattaratanasamannāgato, ayaṁ sattamo sarīranikkhepo.
analyzed: satta ratana samannāgataḥ ayam sattamaḥ sarīra nikkhepo
translated: He possesses the seven treasures. This is the seventh depositing of the relics.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ, ānanda, taṁ padesaṁ samanupassāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yattha tathāgato aṭṭhamaṁ sarīraṁ nikkhipeyyā”ti.
analyzed: na kho pana aha ānanda tam padesam samanupassāmi sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya yattha tathāgataḥ aṭṭhamam sarīram nikkhipeyya ati
translated: But, Ānanda, I do not see that place in the world, with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, where the Tathāgata would deposit the eighth portion of his relics.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Blessed One said.

original: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
analyzed: idam vatvāna sugataḥ atha aparam etat avoca satthā
translated: Having said this, the One of Proper Conduct, the Teacher, further said this:

original: “Aniccā vata saṅkhārā,🔽uppādavayadhammino;
analyzed: aniccā vata saṅkhārā  uppāda vaya dhammino
translated: “Impermanent, indeed, are compounded things;🔽They are subject to arising and vanishing.

original: Uppajjitvā nirujjhanti,
analyzed: uppajjitvā nirujjhanti
translated: Having arisen, they cease;

original: tesaṁ vūpasamo sukho”ti.🔽Mahāsudassanasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: tesam vūpasamaḥ sukhaḥ ti 🔽mahāsudassana suttam niṭṭhitam catuttha
translated: Their stilling is true bliss.”🔽The Sutta on the Great Steward is finished.
